title: Pantone Color of the Year Fashion Shoot with Lindsay Adler
summary: Lindsay Adler demonstrates how to create a monochromatic fashion image inspired by the Pantone Color of the Year 2022, Very Peri. The tutorial covers the lighting setup using three bare bulbs, custom wardrobe styling, and post-processing techniques to achieve a cohesive high-end look.

steps.action: Select the background color to match the theme.
Set up the background light using a single bare bulb on a floor stand to create an even wash of light.
Create a custom dress by wrapping fabric matching the theme color around the model.
Style the model with a blonde wig to create contrast, intending to desaturate it in post-production.
Position the main light (bare bulb) from above to carve out features with hard light.
Add a fill light (bare bulb) on a floor stand to lighten the shadows without eliminating them.
Select camera gear for versatility in framing.
steps.tool: Canon EOS R5, Canon RF 24-105mm f/4 L

steps.action: In post-processing, desaturate the yellows and oranges to turn the blonde wig into a neutral pale color.
Pose the model and capture the final shots.

key_takeaways: Using bare bulbs without modifiers creates hard, poppy, and saturated light ideal for dramatic fashion looks.
When specific clothing isn't available, wrapping fabric can simulate a high-end dress.
Monochromatic looks can be reinforced in post-processing by desaturating conflicting colors (like hair).
Creating work based on trends like the Pantone Color of the Year makes images more relevant to editors and art directors.
